title: المَوَازِين الصَّرْفِيَّة
description: Learn about الموازين الصرفية, the system of using فَعَلَ as a template to analyze and understand Arabic word patterns and their meanings.

notes.title: What is الميزان الصرفي?
content: الميزان الصرفي is a system for analyzing Arabic words using the root فعل (ف-ع-ل) as a template. The ف represents the first root letter, ع the second, and ل the third.
By 'weighing' a word on this scale, we can identify its pattern and understand its grammatical form. كَتَبَ weighs as فَعَلَ, كَاتِب weighs as فَاعِل.
keyPoints: فعل = template with ف (1st), ع (2nd), ل (3rd) root letters
Original letters keep their position on the scale
Added letters appear on the scale too
Helps identify word patterns and meanings

notes.title: Weighing Triliteral Words
content: For three-letter roots, the process is straightforward: replace each root letter with its corresponding ف-ع-ل letter, keeping all vowels and added letters.
If extra letters are added, they appear in the same position on the scale. The extra letters are: س، أ، ل، ت، م، و، ن، ي، ه، ا (remembered as سألتمونيها).
keyPoints: Root letters → ف، ع، ل positions
Added letters (حروف الزيادة) stay in place
سألتمونيها: the letters that can be added

notes.title: Weighing Nouns and Participles
content: Nouns and derived forms also follow the scale. Active participles (اسم الفاعل), passive participles (اسم المفعول), and verbal nouns (المصدر) each have characteristic patterns.
Learning these patterns helps you derive related words from any root.
keyPoints: اسم الفاعل من فَعَلَ = فَاعِل (عَالِم، كَاتِب)
اسم المفعول من فَعَلَ = مَفْعُول (مَعْلُوم، مَكْتُوب)
اسم الفاعل من أَفْعَلَ = مُفْعِل (مُعَلِّم، مُكْرِم)

notes.title: Special Cases in Weighing
content: Some words have modifications due to الإعلال (weak letter changes). When weighing these, we show what happened to the original letters.
قَالَ (original قَوَلَ) weighs as فَعَلَ, but we note the و became ا. Words with deleted letters show the deletion on the scale.
keyPoints: Weak verbs: show original root - قَالَ (ق-و-ل) = فَعَلَ
Deleted letters: shown with their position - قُلْ = فُلْ (ع deleted)
